H0.text: Metamorphosis is the process that makes it possible for plants to use energy from sunlight to produce their own food.

H1.text: Photosynthesis is the process that makes it possible for plants to use energy from sunlight to produce their own food.

H2.text: Pollination is the process that makes it possible for plants to use energy from sunlight to produce their own food.

H3.text: Reproduction is the process that makes it possible for plants to use energy from sunlight to produce their own food.

A4.text: Photosynthesis ( FOH-tə-SINTH-ə-sis) is a system of biological processes by which photopigment-bearing autotrophic organisms, such as most plants, algae and cyanobacteria, convert light energy — typically from sunlight — into the chemical energy necessary to fuel their metabolism.

A5.text: In the light-independent (or 'dark') reactions, the enzyme RuBisCO captures CO2 from the atmosphere and, in a process called the Calvin cycle, uses the newly formed NADPH and releases three-carbon sugars, which are later combined to form sucrose and starch.
